sen.j: 南明寺（なんみょうじ）は奈良県奈良市阪原町にある真言宗御室派の寺院。
sen.e: Nanmyo-ji Temple is a Omuro school of the Shingon sect temple located in Sakahara-cho, Nara City, Nara Prefecture.
Nanmyo-ji Temple is a Omuro school of the Shingon sect temple located in Sakahara-cho, Nara City, Nara Prefecture.
sen.cmt: is a...temple > is a temple of.
sen.e: Nanmyo-ji Temple is a Omuro school of the Shingon sect temple located in Sakahara-cho, Nara City, Nara Prefecture.
The sango (literally, "mountain name"), which is the title prefixed to the name of a Buddhist temple, is Iozan.
The sango (literally, "mountain name"), which is the title prefixed to the name of a Buddhist temple, is Iozan.
The sango (literally, "mountain name"), which is the title prefixed to the name of a Buddhist temple, is Iozan.

sen.j: 奈良市の中心部から柳生の里へ通じる柳生街道沿いに位置する。
sen.e: The temple is located on Yagyu Road connecting the heart of Nara City to Yagyu Village.
The temple is located on Yagyu Road connecting the heart of Nara City to Yagyu Village.
The temple is located on Yagyu Road connecting the heart of Nara City to Yagyu Village.

sen.j: 創建の事情ははっきりしていない。
sen.e: The details of its establishment are unknown.
The details of its establishment are unknown.
The details of its establishment are unknown.

sen.j: 伝承によれば敏達天皇4年（575年）、百済の僧によってこの地に営まれた「槇山千坊」の一であったという（創建年代については宝亀2年・771年とも）。
sen.e: According to legend, the temple was one of the 'Makiyamasenbo' (priest lodges) run by monks from Baekje in 575 (it is also said to have been established in 771).
sen.cmt: 「一であったという」という箇所は、「一つであったという」として訳してあります。「槇山千坊」の正確な読み方が不明のためMakiyamasenboとしてあります。
sen.e: According to legend, the temple was one of the 'Makiyamasenbo' (priest lodges) run by monks from Baekje in 575 (it is also said to have been established in 771).
According to legend, the temple was one of the 'Makiyamasenbo' (priest lodges) run by monks from Baekje in 575 (it is also said to have been established in 771).

sen.j: 現本堂は鎌倉時代中頃の建築と推定され、境内からはこの時代をさかのぼる遺構や出土品などが見つかっていないことから、実際の創建は鎌倉時代頃ではないかと推定されている。
sen.e: The main hall is assumed to have been built in the mid Kamakura period, however, due to the absence of ancient structural remnants or artifacts of the same period found in the precincts of the temple, the entire temple is assumed to have been established in the Kamakura period.

The main hall is assumed to have been built in the mid Kamakura period, however, due to the absence of ancient structural remnants or artifacts of the same period found in the precincts of the temple, the entire temple is assumed to have been established in the Kamakura period.
sen.cmt: assumed > estimated. however > and furthermore. of the same period > from before this time.
sen.e: The main hall is assumed to have been built in the mid Kamakura period, however, due to the absence of ancient structural remnants or artifacts of the same period found in the precincts of the temple, the entire temple is assumed to have been established in the Kamakura period.

sen.j: 本尊をはじめとする仏像は堂より古い平安時代の作であり、他所から移されたものと考えられている。
sen.e: The statues of Buddha, including the principal image of Buddha were made in the Heian period and are older than its hall, so they are assumed to have been brought from other places.
The statues of Buddha, including the principal image of Buddha were made in the Heian period and are older than its hall, so they are assumed to have been brought from other places.
The statues of Buddha, including the principal image of Buddha were made in the Heian period and are older than its hall, so they are assumed to have been brought from other places.

sen.j: 本堂（寄棟造瓦葺、鎌倉時代中期）
sen.e: Hondo (hipped roof style tiled roofs, the mid Kamakura period)

sen.cmt: roofsは二つあり省略しました。

sen.j: 木造薬師如来坐像（一木造漆箔、平安時代中期）
sen.e: Wooden seated statue of Yakushi Nyorai (a wooden figure carved from one tree with lacquered leaf from the mid Heian period)

sen.j: 所在地 奈良市阪原町1005
sen.e: Address 1005 Sakahara-cho, Nara City
sen.cmt: 原文にはコロンはありませんが、「Address」と「1005〜」の間にコロンを入れた方が良いと思います。
sen.e: Address: 1005 Sakahara-cho, Nara City
Address: 1005 Sakahara-cho, Nara City

sen.j: JR奈良駅または近鉄奈良駅より奈良交通バス乗車、阪原バス停下車。
sen.e: Take the Nara Kotsu Bus from the JR Nara Station or the Kintetsu Nara Station to Sakahara.
Take the Nara Kotsu Bus from the JR Nara Station or the Kintetsu Nara Station to Sakahara.
